page.title: 08HEBBURN HOSPITAL GERIATRIC
page.content: The Hebburn Hospital is situated near East View and was built in 1899. We were met by Sister Powell who has been working at the hospital for 12 years. There are 24 patients in the hospital, the eldest being 104 and she has been there 6 years. The youngest patient is 75 and has been there 1 year. There are 5 full time nurses, 10 part time, and their duties are to feed the patients, bath them and generally look after them. The doctor visits them three or four times a week to check on their health. The ladies fill in their spare time by throwing bean bags for exercise, playing Bingo, watching T.V., listening to the radio, knitting and sewing. The Hospital used to be a fever hospital for scarlet fever etc.
